member.name: T:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode
member.summary: Error code for SNMP operations. (0-5 are first defined in SNMP v1, and others are added in v2)

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.NoError
member.summary: There was no problem performing the request.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.TooBig
member.summary: The response to your request was too big to fit into one response.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.NoSuchName
member.summary: An agent was asked to get or set an OID that it can't find; i.e., the OID doesn't exist.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.BadValue
member.summary: A read-write or write-only object was set to an inconsistent value.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.ReadOnly
member.summary: This error is generally not used. The noSuchName error is equivalent to this one.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.GenError
member.summary: This is a catch-all error. If an error occurs for which none of the previous messages is appropriate, a genError is issued.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.NoAccess
member.summary: A set to an inaccessible variable was attempted. This typically occurs when the variable has an ACCESS type of not-accessible.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.WrongType
member.summary: An object was set to a type that is different from its definition. This error will occur if you try to set an object that is of type INTEGER to a string, for example.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.WrongLength
member.summary: An object's value was set to something other than what it calls for. For instance, a string can be defined to have a maximum character size. This error occurs if you try to set a string object to a value that exceeds its maximum length.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.WrongEncoding
member.summary: A set operation was attempted using the wrong encoding for the object being set.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.WrongValue
member.summary: A variable was set to a value it doesn't understand. This can occur when a read-write is defined as an enumeration, and you try to set it to a value that is not one of the enumerated types.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.NoCreation
member.summary: You tried to set a nonexistent variable or create a variable that doesn't exist in the MIB.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.InconsistentValue
member.summary: A MIB variable is in an inconsistent state, and is not accepting any set requests.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.ResourceUnavailable
member.summary: No system resources are available to perform a set.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.CommitFailed
member.summary: This is a catch-all error for set failures.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.UndoFailed
member.summary: A set failed and the agent was unable to roll back all the previous sets up until the point of failure.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.AuthorizationError
member.summary: An SNMP command could not be authenticated; in other words, someone has supplied an incorrect community string.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.NotWritable
member.summary: A variable will not accept a set, even though it is supposed to.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.ErrorCode.InconsistentName
member.summary: You attempted to set a variable, but that attempt failed because the variable was in some kind of inconsistent state.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.GenericCode.ColdStart
member.summary: Indicates that the agent has rebooted. All management variables will be reset; specifically, Counters and Gauges will be reset to zero (0). One nice thing about the coldStart trap is that it can be used to determine when new hardware is added to the network. When a device is powered on, it sends this trap to its trap destination. If the trap destination is set correctly (i.e., to the IP address of your NMS) the NMS can receive the trap and determine whether it needs to manage the device.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.GenericCode.WarmStart
member.summary: Indicates that the agent has reinitialized itself. None of the management variables will be reset.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.GenericCode.LinkDown
member.summary: Sent when an interface on a device goes down. The first variable binding identifies which interface went down.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.GenericCode.LinkUp
member.summary: Sent when an interface on a device comes back up. The first variable binding identifies which interface came back up.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.GenericCode.AuthenticationFailure
member.summary: Indicates that someone has tried to query your agent with an incorrect community string; useful in determining if someone is trying to gain unauthorized access to one of your devices.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.GenericCode.EgpNeighborLoss
member.summary: Indicates that an Exterior Gateway Protocol (EGP) neighbor has gone down.

member.name: F:GSF.Net.Snmp.GenericCode.EnterpriseSpecific
member.summary: Indicates that the trap is enterprise-specific. SNMP vendors and users define their own traps under the private-enterprise branch of the SMI object tree. To process this trap properly, the NMS has to decode the specific trap number that is part of the SNMP message.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Snmp.Messaging.Messenger.MaxMessageSize
member.remarks: You can use any value for your own application. Also this value may be changed in #SNMP in future releases.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Snmp.Messaging.Messenger.DecryptionError
member.summary: If the privacy module returns failure, then the message can not be processed, so the usmStatsDecryptionErrors counter is incremented and an error indication (decryptionError) together with the OID and value of the incremented counter is returned to the calling module.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Snmp.Messaging.Messenger.AuthenticationFailure
member.summary: If the authentication module returns failure, then the message cannot be trusted, so the usmStatsWrongDigests counter is incremented and an error indication (authenticationFailure) together with the OID and value of the incremented counter is returned to the calling module.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Snmp.Messaging.Messenger.UnknownEngineId
member.summary: If the value of the msgAuthoritativeEngineID field in the securityParameters is unknown then the usmStatsUnknownEngineIDs counter is incremented, and an error indication (unknownEngineID) together with the OID and value of the incremented counter is returned to the calling module.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Snmp.Messaging.Messenger.UnknownSecurityName
member.summary: Information about the value of the msgUserName and msgAuthoritativeEngineID fields is extracted from the Local Configuration Datastore (LCD, usmUserTable). If no information is available for the user, then the usmStatsUnknownUserNames counter is incremented and an error indication (unknownSecurityName) together with the OID and value of the incremented counter is returned to the calling module.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Snmp.Messaging.Messenger.NotInTimeWindow
member.summary: If the message is considered to be outside of the Time Window then the usmStatsNotInTimeWindows counter is incremented and an error indication (notInTimeWindow) together with the OID, the value of the incremented counter, and an indication that the error must be reported with a securityLevel of authNoPriv, is returned to the calling module

member.name: P:GSF.Net.Snmp.Messaging.Messenger.UnsupportedSecurityLevel
member.summary: If the information about the user indicates that it does not support the securityLevel requested by the caller, then the usmStatsUnsupportedSecLevels counter is incremented and an error indication (unsupportedSecurityLevel) together with the OID and value of the incremented counter is returned to the calling module.

member.summary:
Return maximum encryption/decryption key length. For DES, returned value is 16.

member.name: E:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.OnProgress
member.summary: Event that is being called while data is being transferred.

member.name: E:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.OnFinished
member.summary: Event that will be called once the data transfer is finished.

member.name: E:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.OnError
member.summary: Event that will be called if there is an error during the data transfer. Currently, this will return instances of ErrorFromRemoteEndpoint or NetworkError.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.TransferMode
member.summary: Requested TFTP transfer mode. For outgoing transfers, this member may be used to set the transfer mode.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.BlockSize
member.summary: Transfer block size. Set this member to control the TFTP block size option (RFC 2349).

member.name: P:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.RetryTimeout
member.summary: Timeout after which commands are sent again. This member is also transmitted as the TFTP timeout interval option (RFC 2349).

member.name: P:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.RetryCount
member.summary: Number of times that a RetryTimeout may occur before the transfer is cancelled with a TimeoutError.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.BlockCounterWrapping
member.summary: TFTP can transfer up to 65535 blocks. After that, the block counter wraps to either zero or one, depending on the expectations of the client.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.ExpectedSize
member.summary: Expected transfer size in bytes. 0 if size is unknown.

member.name: P:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.UserContext
member.summary: You can set your own object here to associate custom data with this transfer.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.Start(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Call this function to start the transfer.
member.param: The stream from which data is either read (when sending) or written to (when receiving).

member.name: M:GSF.Net.TFtp.ITFtpTransfer.Cancel(GSF.Net.TFtp.TFtpErrorPacket)
member.summary: Cancel the currently running transfer, possibly sending the provided reason to the remote endpoint.

member.name: T:GSF.Net.TFtp.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains classes used to establish Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) clients and servers for uploading and downloading files.

member.name: T:GSF.Net.TFtp.TFtpClient
member.summary: A TFTP client that can connect to a TFTP server.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.TFtp.TFtpClient.#ctor(System.Net.IPEndPoint)
member.param: Address of the server that you would like to connect to.

member.param: Address of the server that you want connect to.
Port on the server that you want connect to (default: 69)

member.name: M:GSF.Net.TFtp.TFtpClient.#ctor(System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary: Connects to a server on port 69.
member.param: Address of the server that you want connect to.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.TFtp.TFtpClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Connect to a server by hostname.
member.param: Hostname or IP to connect to

member.name: M:GSF.Net.TFtp.TFtpClient.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Connect to a server by hostname and port .
member.param: Hostname or IP to connect to

member.name: M:GSF.Net.TFtp.TFtpClient.Download(System.String)
member.summary: GET a file from the server. You have to call Start() on the returned ITFtpTransfer to start the transfer.

member.name: M:GSF.Net.TFtp.TFtpClient.Upload(System.String)
member.summary: PUT a file from the server. You have to call Start() on the returned ITFtpTransfer to start the transfer.
